ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.description:
This utility allows an easy way to add end-to-end cryptographic attestation
to patches sent via mail. It does so by adapting the DKIM email signature
standard to include cryptographic signatures via the X-Developer-Signature
email header.

If your project workflow doesn't use patches sent via email, then you don't
need this and should simply start signing your tags and commits.
about.summary: A simple library to add cryptographic attestation to patches sent via email

about.description:
This utility allows an easy way to add end-to-end cryptographic attestation
to patches sent via mail. It does so by adapting the DKIM email signature
standard to include cryptographic signatures via the X-Developer-Signature
email header.

If your project workflow doesn't use patches sent via email, then you don't
need this and should simply start signing your tags and commits.
about.summary: A simple library to add cryptographic attestation to patches sent via email

name: patatt
raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  version: 0.6.3

package:
  name: patatt
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://mirrors.edge.kernel.org/pub/software/devel/patatt/patatt-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: a5b7511d9694a3448f25cc7db2df545605fcbadd5dd509484b656f5be123e56d

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: python
  script: python -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  python:
    entry_points:
      - patatt=patatt:command

requirements:
  host:
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }}
    - pynacl

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - patatt
      python_version: ${{ python_min }}.*
  - requirements:
      run:
        - pip
        - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    script:
      - pip check
      - patatt --help

about:
  summary: A simple library to add cryptographic attestation to patches sent via email
  description: |
    This utility allows an easy way to add end-to-end cryptographic attestation
    to patches sent via mail. It does so by adapting the DKIM email signature
    standard to include cryptographic signatures via the X-Developer-Signature
    email header.

    If your project workflow doesn't use patches sent via email, then you don't
    need this and should simply start signing your tags and commits.
  license: MIT
  license_file: COPYING
  homepage: https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/utils/patatt/patatt.git/about/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - blmaier
